org.jhove2.core.io
Interface Input

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractInput, DirectInput, MappedInput, NonDirectInput
public interface Input

JHOVE2 input, an I/O abstraction used for parsing the contents of source units.

Author:
MStrong

Nested Class Summary
static class Input.Type
          AbstractInput buffer type.

          Marker indicating end-of-file.
static int MAX_MAPPED_FILE
          Maximum file size region that can mapped ~1.6 GB.

          Marker indicating an uninitialized value.

          Close the input and release all underlying system I/O resources.

Method Detail

close

void close()
           throws IOException
Close the input and release all underlying system I/O resources.

Throws:
IOException - I/O exception closing input

getBuffer

ByteBuffer getBuffer()
Get the ByteBuffer underlying the Input. If the buffer position is locally manipulated, the resetBuffer() method must be invoked prior to reading the Input.

Returns:
Buffer underlying the Input
See Also:
resetBuffer()

int getBufferSize()
Get current buffer size, in bytes.

Returns:

Returns:

readChar

char readChar()
              throws EOFException,
                     IOException
Get UTF-16BE Unicode character at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by two bytes.

Returns:
Characer at the current position
Throws:
EOFException
IOException

readDouble

double readDouble()
                  throws IOException
Get signed double float point at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by eight bytes.

Returns:
signed double floating point at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException

readFloat

float readFloat()
                throws IOException
Get signed 32 bit floating point float at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by four bytes.

Returns:
signed 32 bit floating point float at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException

readSignedByte

byte readSignedByte()
                    throws IOException
Get signed byte at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by one byte.

Returns:
Signed byte at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading byte

readSignedInt

int readSignedInt()
                  throws IOException
read signed (four byte) integer at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by four bytes.

Returns:
Unsigned integer at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading int

readSignedShort

short readSignedShort()
                      throws IOException
Get signed short at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by two bytes.

Returns:
Signed short at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading short

readSignedLong

long readSignedLong()
                    throws IOException
Get signed long at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by eight bytes.

Returns:
Signed long at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading long

readUnsignedByte

short readUnsignedByte()
                       throws IOException
read unsigned byte at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by one byte.

Returns:
Unsigned byte at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading byte

readUnsignedShort

int readUnsignedShort()
                      throws IOException
read unsigned short (two byte) integer at the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by two bytes.

Returns:
Unsigned short integer at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading short

readUnsignedInt

long readUnsignedInt()
                     throws IOException
read unsigned (four byte) integer at the the current position. This implicitly advances the current position by four bytes.

Returns:
Unsigned integer at the current position, or -1 if EOF
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception reading int

resetBuffer

void resetBuffer()
Reset the buffer position. This method is only necessary after a buffer has been retrieved via getBuffer() and the position of that local copy has been manipulated.

See Also:
getBuffer()

setByteOrder

void setByteOrder(ByteOrder order)
Set byte order: big-endian or little-endian.

Parameters:
order - Byte order

setDeleteTempFileOnClose

void setDeleteTempFileOnClose(boolean flag)
Set temporary file deletion flag; if true, delete on close.

Parameters:
flag - Delete temporary files flag

setPosition

void setPosition(long position)
                 throws IOException
Set current position, as a byte offset.

Parameters:
position - Position, as a byte offset
Throws:
IOException - I/O exception setting position

setBufferType

void setBufferType(Input.Type type)
